      public static final String RESET
      ANSI escape code used to reset terminal text formatting and styles to their default values. It is commonly used to clear any previously applied text color, background color, or style.

    • BG_ORANGE

      public static final String BG_ORANGE
      Represents the ANSI escape code for setting the background color to orange in terminal-based user interface output. The specific color corresponds to the 208th color in the extended 256-color palette.

    • BG_GRAY

      public static final String BG_GRAY

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • BG_LIME_GREEN

      public static final String BG_LIME_GREEN
      Represents the ANSI escape code for setting the background color to lime green in terminal-based applications that support ANSI color codes. The value "[48;5;118m" changes the terminal's background color to a lime green shade. This variable is typically used in conjunction with text output or other terminal formatting to visually enhance or highlight elements with a lime green background. It is part of a collection of predefined foreground and background ANSI color constants.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • BLOCK

      public static final char BLOCK
      A constant representing a filled block character `█` used for graphical representations or UI elements, often in text-based displays or terminal interfaces. Typically utilized when a uniform-width or monospace character is required for consistent alignment.
      See Also:

    • getCharacter

      public static String getCharacter(char character, String color)
      Returns a string representation of a character formatted with the specified color.
      Parameters:
      character - the character to be formatted
      color - the color code to apply to the character
      Returns:
      the formatted character as a string with the specified color

    • block

      public static String block(String color)
      Returns a string representation of a block character with the specified color.
      Parameters:
      color - the color to apply to the block character
      Returns:
      the block character as a colored string

    • arrowUp

      public static String arrowUp(String color)
      Returns a string representation of an upward arrow symbol with the specified color.
      Parameters:
      color - the color to style the upward arrow symbol; must be a valid color string.
      Returns:
      the colored upward arrow symbol as a string.

      a string containing the upward triangle character styled with the specified color.

    • colorText

      public static String colorText(String text, String textColor, String backgroundColor)
      Adds text color and background color to the given text.
      Parameters:
      text - the text to be styled with colors
      textColor - the color to be applied to the text
      backgroundColor - the color to be applied to the background
      Returns:
      a string that combines the specified text, text color, and background color

    • printCard

      public void printCard(Card card, LittleModelRepresentation lmr)
      Prints the details of a given card based on its type and the associated model representation. The method handles multiple card types and renders appropriate visuals and information specific to each type.
      Parameters:
      card - The card object containing details about the card being printed.
      lmr - The LittleModelRepresentation object, used to provide additional data such as dice values for certain card types.

    • printFlightBoard

      public void printFlightBoard(FlightBoard fb)
      Prints the flight board to the console in a formatted style based on the size of the board and player details.
      Parameters:
      fb - The FlightBoard object containing the details of the board, such as its size, player positions, and other configurations required for displaying the board.

    • printShipBoard

      public void printShipBoard(ShipBoard shipBoard)
      Prints the visual representation of the given ShipBoard.
      Parameters:
      shipBoard - The ShipBoard object to be printed. This contains details about the ship matrix, player information, and waiting tile positions for visualization.

    • printTile

      public void printTile(SpaceShipTile tile)
      Prints the visual representation of a spaceship tile to the console.
      Parameters:
      tile - the SpaceShipTile object representing the tile to be printed

    • printTilesArray

      public void printTilesArray(ArrayList<SpaceShipTile> tiles)
      Displays a graphical representation of an array of tiles, formatted into rows with a maximum number of tiles per row. Each tile is represented visually along with its identifier centered above it.
      Parameters:
      tiles - an ArrayList of SpaceShipTile objects representing the tiles to be displayed; if null or empty, a message indicating no tiles will be displayed

    • printCommand

      public void printCommand(List<CommandType> commands)
      Prints a formatted list of available commands along with their descriptions and usage instructions.
      Parameters:
      commands - a list of CommandType instances representing the commands to be displayed. Each command includes a code, description, and optional usage examples or rules to assist the user.

    • printSupportingHand

      public static void printSupportingHand(String nickname)
      Prints a supporting hand ASCII art and a given nickname.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname to be displayed below the supporting hand ASCII art

    • printThingInHand

      public void printThingInHand(Object ThingInHand, String playerNickname, LittleModelRepresentation lmr)
      Prints the details of the object the player is currently holding in hand, based on its type. The method supports printing information for either a Deck of cards or a SpaceShipTile. If the object is null, an appropriate message will be displayed.
      Parameters:
      ThingInHand - the object currently in the player's hand, which can be either a Deck or SpaceShipTile
      playerNickname - the nickname of the player whose hand information is being processed
      lmr - the little model representation used to provide additional data for processing the object in hand
